111.content:
"Danny, all I'm saying is a little bit of exercise would do you some good. Plus it would probly help you fight ghosts." Sam whispers as Danny, herself, and Tucker make their way through the crowded hall between classes.
"She has a point Danny, your ghost powers can only help you so much in your daily life. You can't use them all the time. Plus it might help with the fact that Dash has been seriosly on your case man." Tucker helpfully points out.
"I know, I know. You've been giving me this lecture for about a week now! I told you that between my normal life, and ghost fighting I don't have the time."
"I could organize your schedule." Offers Tuck.
"And, I could be your health instructer," chimed Sam.
"I told you, I'm not going to-OOF!" Being so preoccupied with Sam and Tuckers nagging, Danny failed to notice where he was walking. And, walked right into Dash's fist.
"What have we here? A homing nerd?" Dash crows as he pulls Danny off the ground by his shirt coller. He then easily lifts Danny above his head, winding back for a clean punch to the gut. All eyes are now on Danny and Dash.
'Man, if only I could use my powers without getting caught. Or steal Dash's streangth so he couldn't beat on me.' Danny thinks as he reaches up to grab Dash's wrist in an atempt to escape before the punch connected. A sudden bright green flash fills the hall, knocking Danny and Dash into opposing walls.
"What was that?" Danny mumbles as he rubs his head. He then regesters the screaming. "Uh-oh. I-I can explaine!* But it doesn't matter, cuase floating in front of him is none other than the -.
"BEWARE!!" Boxghost yells, and floats off.
Through the panic Danny can hear another voice from the other side of the hall.
"Fenton! You and me! The Guys Locker Room after school. Be there or else." Dash runs off.
Tucker and Sam help Danny up. "Dude what just happened? There was that flash, and then the Boxghost showed up. Was that flash him?"
"More importantly, are you ok Danny?" Sam asks, shooting Tucker a glare for not being more concerned.
"I'm fine. A matter of fact I feel better then I did before I touched Dash." Danny looks at himself. "Do I look different to you?"
"Weelllll..." Both look him over. "Not really, but your clothes look a little small for you now."
Danny smirks, "That's all I needed to hear. Guys I think that flash was me, and bet I'm going to enjoy meetting Dash after school today."
111.title: A New Power

1111.content:
Danny stood before the door to the boys’ locker room, a bit nervous about what he was going to do. Or, at least try to do. Sam and Tucker stood on either side of him, both looking just as nervous as Danny felt. He couldn't get past the fact that ghost fighting almost came naturally to him these days, and it no longer scared him the rest of the way to death. But Dash scared him more than any of those ghosts did, and he didn't know why. At least.... He had a general idea why. Mainly the fact that he couldn't use his powers openly with out getting caught; or it could be that he was constantly tempted to take that step over the edge to actually do something. And, he knew he could do it too. But now was different. Now he could use his powers for something he really wanted, and if he was careful still not get caught.
"You ready for this Danny? You know you don't really have to go through with this."
"No Sam, actually I do."
"Why?"
"I can't say, but I just do. You guys will wait for me out here right?"
"Sure thing man, I've got the first aid kit right here ready to go."
"Thanks, but I hope I won’t need it." He takes a step towards the door. A hand reaches out to grab him.
"Danny, whatever you’re planning, be careful."
"I will Sam." 'Shesh, how do they always know something’s up.' "Don’t worry about me." He sighs, and tries to smile. Sam lets go, reassured. Danny finishes moving towards the door, pushes it open and enters. Inside, the doors silently close behind him; a musky wet smell fills the room from the last gym class. The lights aren't all on, and a shower head can be heard dripping in the back. 'Well I'll give Dash points on the evil scale for the scenery.' He makes his way towards the back; trying not to breath and break the looming silence. He thinks he sees something move out of the corner of his eye, and knows the familiar feeling he gets from Skalker when he’s being hunted happening right now. His hair on the back of his neck starts to stand up. ‘I’m not going to jump, I’m not going to ju-!’
“Look who decided to show up! Fenturd, all by his lone some.” Dash crows from behind, as Danny jumps in the air from shock. “What shall we do with him boys?”
‘Boys? I thought it was going to just be the two of us?’ “Dash, it was just you and me.” Starting to get ticked about forgetting that jerks don’t play fare.
“Plans change dweb. Grab ‘im guys.” These two big teammates step out and slam Danny into the wall; though one could have held him. They both stood to the side so Dash could have a clean punch.
Rage filled Danny at this point. ‘These thugs lied to me again! They never fight fair!’ another voice seems to chime up. Sneering ‘What did you expect? An apology? You have the power. USE IT!’ The voice thundered these words into Danny; his rage building. He struggled to control himself, trying to think of any other way out as Dash came closer.
1111.title: No Escape

choices: Danny decides to steal a few more bodies of muscle.
Danny wants to take all the muscle from all the kids in the entire school!
11111.content:
Danny decided he wasn't going to hold back anymore. He started to use his power. He started taking muscle. Dash swung his fist forward into Danny's mouth, but when his fist got there, there was no muscle left on Dash's arm.
"What the?" cried Dash, shocked to only see a bony arm, with his fist on the end of it.
Meanwhile, Dash's muscle had transferred onto Danny's arm!
"Well Dash,” the muscular-armed Danny said, "It seems you've lost some muscle there. You look pretty uneven, with one huge arm and one puny bony one.
How about I take care of that for you?"
Instantly, Dash's arm shriveled to nothing but skin-and-bone, and Danny's arm rose with the new muscle, his bicep nearly 22 inches with his and Dash's muscle. Dash speechlessly looked at his other arm and was shocked to find nothing. Dash's two jock friends stared, jaws dropped, at what they saw.
"Well, Dash, looks like you've got no remaining muscle in your arms. However, I look pretty strange with these huge arms and no developed chest or abs.
Mind if I borrow yours?"
Dash started to run, and he got halfway to the door, but Danny took all the muscle in his legs, and Dash fell over. Danny quickly took the muscle from the other two jocks' legs, and they fell over as well.
"You're not thinking, Dash, you aren't cooperating. Just for that, I'm taking every pound of muscle off your body!"
"No!" screamed Dash, but it was no use. Soon, he felt his muscular 8 pack melt away onto Danny's body. His once gigantic pecs, disappearing, shrinking into Danny's body, and off of his. His muscular Neck and shoulders? You guessed it. Danny had taken everything off of Dash. 200 pounds of Dash's muscle, which rivaled that of a NFL football player, now belonged to Danny, leaving Dash a 90-pound weakling.
Danny turned to the other two jocks, who were just slightly smaller than Dash; grabbed them in his two hands, and sucked every pound of what was left of them, and their height as well. Danny grew taller, and more muscular. His chest became thicker and thicker, his pecs blocking his view of the ground, his abs destroying logic, being a solid 12 pack set of abs, with fit his new 8 foot stature perfectly.
His muscular chest soon quickly ripped through the shirt, tearing it to shreds, his jeans in tatters on the floor. Luckily, his boxers held tight.
He left the two jocks 90 pounds, just like Dash, shriveled and weak. Danny, who was a pathetic 140 pounds before today, now weighed in at 720 pounds of sheer muscle, Danny looked down at his body, and laughed in his new, unbelievably deep voice. He dropped one of the puny jocks in his hands, to look for clothes. He ripped open each locker, his new obscene muscle not making it a problem, until he found an extra stretchy sweatshirt. He put it on, although the sleeves only came down to his 35 inch biceps. He also found some extra large jeans an obese kid wore, and put these on, fitting tightly on his bulging muscular legs. He picked up one jock, and threw him across the room. He grabbed the other jock with his other hand, and Danny went over to Dash, who was lying on the floor, physically unable to move. Danny picked his skinny, pathetic body with one hand, and said,
"Well Dash, I think things are gonna be different around here from now on."
11111.title: Danny's Sweet Revenge

choices: Danny keeps the remaining muscle all for himself (and steals some more?)
Danny shares some more of his recently obtained muscle with the other weak guys.
111111.content:
Dropping Dash into a weakened heap on the floor, Danny walked out of the locker room, greatly surprising Sam and Tucker as his massive body about knocked them to the floor.

Danny was taking very long strides now, forcing the duo to lightly jog to keep up with their very muscular friend.

"D-Danny, how did this happen to you?" asked Sam, slightly distracted by his massive body.
"Oh, I been working out my new ghost power. I think it's paid off, don't you think?" replied Danny, giving his bicep a flex, which practically tore the shirt he now wore. "Now I think I'll 'work out' some more on the rest of the jocks, let them know who the REAL man is in this school now. But don't worry, I don't hurt anyone, just make sure those soon-to-be-weak jocks get a taste of their own medicine, than I might...spread the love around with some of the geeks, let them have a bit of fun."

The jocks weren't hard to find, they were waiting just outside the school to congratulate Dash on a 'job' well done, and then go do jock-ish things. Unfortunately, what they obviously hadn't expected was a much larger Danny walking through the doors, his head almost hitting the doorframe, and his shoulders practically touching the sides. All of which was placed under Danny's head, the same one who they knew as the school shrimp (seriously, even some freshman seemed more muscular than him); now though, he was bigger, stronger, and very, very mad.

"C-C-Come on guys! He may be bigger, but we outnumber him! He can't take us all on at once!" shakily said one of the jocks, which was enough to rouse his comrades.

The group surrounded Danny on all sides, Sam and Tucker decided to hide, mostly wanting to see how exactly Danny had gotten so large.

"O-ok guys, on the count of 3, jump him!" said another jock who then counted down and then they jumped on Danny.

Danny only pretended to be overburdened, he could have easily lifted and tossed them away like nothing, but he wanted to be sure that the muscle he was about to gain was of top quality. At the bottom of the dogpile, Danny focused on all of the jocks on him, and slowly took their muscle away. It took the jocks a minute to realize that they were being pushed away by Danny, even though he wasn't moving. After taking pretty much all of their muscle, Danny stood up, and up, and a bit more up after that. The jocks watched this as well, not realizing that most of their now-oversized clothes had fallen off of them.

Danny couldn't believe how big he was, all of that jock muscle gave him such a feeling of power, it was almost more than he thought he could handle. He picked up one of the ex-'jocks' and held him there. He couldn't believe he was scared of such small people now. He took off the wimps jacket and shirt, and picked up a pair of shoes and pants, then took the quivering person over towards where Tucker and Sam were hiding.

"Tucker, come over here. I know that you're here." said Danny in a demanding tone. Tucker came out shaking like a leaf from his hiding spot, though Sam decided to stay there. "Tucker, put on these clothes and give your clothes to him." Tucker did as he was asked, looking at the ex-jock, who was now his size without all of his muscle. Tuckers clothes practically fit like a glove, though the ex-jocks clothes weren't quite the same on him.

Danny then set down the jock, but told him to stay put, and then picked up Tucker, still rather scared of his massive friend. Danny concentrated on his tiny friend and then after a bit of a green flash, Tucker then stood like one of the old jocks; stronger, taller, faster. Nowhere near Danny's extreme size (who hadn't gotten any smaller from the transfer), but Tucker now knew what it was like to be big. He flexed his bicep and watched as a ball formed on his arm and pushed the fabric almost to tearing. He pulled up his pant leg and watched as a massive calf looking like a big heart slapped behind his shin, and he couldn't even get it high enough to see his thigh. He could feel the power of his rock-hard six pack through his new shirt and flexed them hard, making them even harder.

-----

Setting him down, Danny was curious as to what to do next. He had knocked down all the jocks from their pedastal, and it appears that he could even make others stronger, though he didn't seem to lose any muscle in the process. It was certainly interesting to the massive muscle teen. But then again, why stop at the jocks? Certainly there were many more people to steal muscle from, not like anyone ever really helped him. He was a hero, he deserved a bit of a reward, even if no one realized it.

"The hard choices we have to make in life." Danny thought to himself.

11112.content:
'You have the power, USE IT!' the voice continued to echo in Danny's head.
'I can't, it's not right.' Danny struggled in vain with his captors and the voice in his mind.
'Is what they're doing to you right? Give them what they deserve; use your power! You don't have to take it all, just enough to not be hurt.'
'But, I-'
'Isn't that what you were planning in the first place?' Dash pulls back to strike, 'Just DO IT!'
Suddenly, everything seems to come into focus as Danny realized that this voice is right. He had planned to steal Dash's strength, now he can just do it to two other jerks as well. Immediately he starts pulling what he needs from the two holding him. A single word flowing through his mind; armor. Soon as he thought this he could feel the changes begin inside of himself and the two jocks. He could feel the power in their chests and stomachs flowing into him. The definition and size of their muscles decreasing while his grew; he tried with all his self control to compact that power as tight as possible so no one could see him growing.
Within the time it took Dash to swing his fist into Danny's stomach; Danny had stolen two fifths of each of the two jocks abs and chest muscle. And, even though he hardly felt anything through his now rock hard stomach he screamed as painfully as possible. Dash smirked; leaving his fist pressed into Danny for emphasis and the sheer pleasure.
'That's it you jerk, practically give me your strength.' Danny thinks while smirking inwardly. He immediately starts pulling from Dash's physic. Before Dash could pull away Danny had taken two fifths of Dash's pecs and abs as well. Danny now having the strength of 1.1 football players packed tightly into his now well developed chest and stomach. Dash pulled away, grabbing his head, and feeling a little dizzy.
'Now for the rest.'
Danny began pulling from the rest of his three 'tormentors' bodies.
'First some height,' Danny thought as he took a total of three inches from each jock; resulting in a growth spurt of nine inches. He noted with pleasure that the three nitwits became dizzy from this for a moment. And due to this, their low IQ, and the dim light, none of them noticed that Danny stood at eye level with Dash.
'Next the legs and feet.' He almost felt like whistling as he felt his feet grow three sizes in his shoes. His calves tightened into diamonds while his thighs thickened, and his butt ballooned into a large bubble of fat and muscle.
'This feels great.' He thought, almost forgetting he was being bullied. 'Now for the back, shoulders, and neck.'
Once again he took two fifths from each, feeling the power flowing through him, and his clothes fitting a little differently. Other than that he could feel his back and neck problems disappearing.
'Next the arms, and then the heart and lungs.' His arms tightened, thickened, balled, striated with blood vessels as he felt the power flowing through him, and the grip of the two jocks weakened as he went. Finally he went inward, pulling away the size of the jocks lungs and heart. He could feel his breaths getting deeper and hear his heart beat in his ears as these vital organs grew. He could see Dash getting winded thanks to this, and knew it was time to beg.
"Please Dash, stop. I-I'm sorry, just stop." Danny sobbed, and whimpered trying to sound like he was really in pain. Dash stood there breathing heavily from the workout.
"Well I guess that's enough learning for today Fentonie," Dash spoke normally, trying to hide how tired he felt, "We'll continue your lesson tomorrow," to add emphasis he punched his fists together. "Now get!"
The two jocks let go of Danny, and he hobbled towards the door ,"Thank-You Dash!" He pushed his way out, and turned to see Sam and Tucker waiting.
"You all right man?"
"Yeah Tuck I'm fine.
"You wanna get something at the Nasty Burger?" Sam asked, placing her hand on his shoulder. She noticed that something felt..... different, she just couldn't tell what.
"Well, I-

Danny sputtered out some soda he was drinking right onto Tucker then stuttered, "Y-y-you would??"

"Danny, don't worry about her, we all know if you even tried to hit on Paulina, you would have the stuffing beat out of you from Dash and the rest of them." said Sam, putting a hand on Danny's shoulder.

Danny wasn't paying attention. He could tell Paulina actually liked him but she wasn't going to be easy to catch. She set a high goal, a goal he would have to take by the horns, even if he didn't get to go out with Paulina.

"I'm going home, I've had a long day. I'll see you guys tomorrow." said Danny, getting up without waiting for a reply.

After they parted, Danny went ghost and flew out of the airport, carrying Sam on his soft back. Sam just cuddled into Danny's fat, enjoying the ride.

"Of course." Sam said. "We can't have your beautiful body getting smaller, can we?"

THE END

She seriously considered going back to sleep for a few hours, but she felt a nagging hunger pain that forced her to slowly pull herself out of bed and stumble down to the kitchen. As she made her journey, she noticed that no one was home. Her parents were probably out doing something.

Patting her growling stomach, Sam stepped into the kitchen and started searching for her favorite treats. What she found was too horrible for her to imagine: they were out of food! She checked and rechecked every pantry, shelf, and drawer, and couldn't find a single edible thing. Then again, there had been a box of baking soda in the fridge...was she really that hungry? Another loud stomach gurgle made it clear that yes, she was, and she dove for the fridge.

As she lifted the baking soda to her mouth, Sam spied two packages of tofu dogs. How had she missed those? She honestly thought she had eaten the last of the tofu dogs days ago. She happily grabbed and tore open one of the packages, and placed one of the dogs in her mouth, slowly chewing it as it slid down her throat.

Something was different about these dogs...they were delicious! So full of flavor. She would have to remind her mother to buy this brand again. Lately her parents had indulged her behavior completely, which Sam took as a sign that they were accepting her for who she was. Actually, her parents simply thought that pigging out and watching television was a "normal" thing to do, and that this might trigger a change in their skinny, gothic daughter.

Slipping another sausage into her mouth, Sam took a seat by the television. She grabbed the remote, leaned back, and turned it on. The screen lit up to show a rerun of some old reality TV show. Sam knew it was stupid and pointless, but she couldn't take her eyes off of it. She gazed upon the screen with all the attention that her blank stare allowed, rhythmically shoving the tofu dogs into her mouth.

When the commercial break came up a few minutes later, she was completely out of food. "I'm still so hungry...must be all the hard work I've been doing. Good thing I saved the other package." She took a moment to tear herself away from the TV, and shuffled over to the kitchen.

Taped to the fridge was a handwritten note that she hadn't noticed while tearing the kitchen apart earlier. She stared dumbfounded as she tried to make sense of what she was reading:

"Dear Sam,

Went grocery shopping. Don't touch the hot dogs in the fridge, they're for your dad and his friends tonight.

Love,

Mom."

Sam was completely shocked. She opened the fridge and looked at the package: they weren't tofu dogs, they were generic brand hot dogs. Her worst fears had come true: She had killed an animal for food. Her mind raced as she imagined all of the things in that hot dog. Cow. Pig. Intestines. Dog. Rat? Maybe even skunk? She wanted to throw up, but, as disgusted as she was, she couldn't help but remember how great they tasted. She could feel her willpower starting to waver...
1212222.title: Sam develops a taste for meat.

Sam pukes up all of the food she has eaten

12122222.title: Sam gives in and scarfs down the hotdogs.

1221.title: Danny the Cashier

choices: It's just the manager, better eat it all!
it's one of Danny's rivals, and they have something planed for Sam...
12211.content:
Danny shifted nervously behind the counter it was nearly the lunch rush and this was Danny's first day. Danny looked out at the empty parking lot as cars began to pass by, the traffic was getting heavier, the lunch hour rush would soon be pulling in and his boss would be watching to make sure he could handle it. Danny adjusted his small paper hat for the fifth time in an hour and made sure his name tag was still straight since the last time he looked five minutes ago.

Danny patted the counter as a car or two pulled into the parking lot, but rather than park and come inside they pulled around to the side to the drive through. Danny looked over at Diana, the girl working the window, she'd been working here for 8 months and didn't look nearly as nervous as Danny. Danny let out a long sigh trying to calm down, this job meant a lot to him. He could finally buy something to impress Paulina that his normal allowance didn't really have a budget for, or even afford a nice date, minimum wage wasn't much but at 190 dollars every two weeks after taxes he could certainly afford a very nice candle lit dinner. Yeah Paulina would sure be impressed, he mused to himself

"or Sam..." His subconscious murmured in the back of his mind

Danny shook his head "Sam.. just a friend" he thought back. Danny looked up at the ceiling "It's not like I got this job to impress HER, I mean she's rich, just because it would be a really romantic gesture to ask her out and pay for everything rather than split the bill like we normally do... she might find that sweet... wonder if she'd kiss me..." He began to whisper. Danny choked nervously, was he saying that out loud!? Danny looked around wildly to make sure no one heard him, he sighed with relief when he saw no one was close enough and rested his back against the counter to clam himself down. Suddenly a voice from behind him shook him not only back to reality but also scared him half to death, it was Sam herself.

"Hey Danny!" She said as cheerfully as she would get, the happy sweet girl voice not really her thing but she managed one every now and then when speaking to Danny. "How's the first day going so far? Make any big mistakes yet?

"Gah, heh, hey Sam. M-mistakes? What makes you think I'm messing up?" Danny worried getting slightly defensive

"Whoa whoa calm down Danny" Sam cautioned him "I was only kidding, I'm sure you're doing fine."

"Right, kidding... heh heh" he nervously laughed "Sorry first day jitters you know?

Sam and Danny looked at each other quietly for several moments before Sam cut into the awkward stare

"Well?" she asked him quizzically

"Well what?" Danny asked suddenly worried

"well.... aren't you going to take my order?" Sam asked him with a sarcastic tone

"OH! uh sorry... you're making me nervous" Danny said with a sigh as Sam shot him a questionable look "Er, I mean not you making me nervous, but just the situation, you're my first real customer, the boss is watching and..."

"Oh, say no more, lets just pretend you gave me the stupid Nasty Burger greeting your corporate puppet masters force on you, I didn't want to hear you reciting that stupid line anyway, you'd sound like a tool." Sam joked "Ok I'll have..." Sam began scanning the menu "3 nasty burger cheese burgers, 2 orders of fries and a large chocolate milkshake"

"Ok 'miss' coming right up" Danny announced trying to sound professional as he hopelessly hunted for the cheeseburger button on the reregister.

"Danny... you taking me seriously?" Sam laughed "You must be freaking out about this job, you know I'm a Vegetarian, well technically a Vegan... but Nasty burger's options are limited and I can live with eating a vegetarian's lunch, after all I couldn't see you if I was going to be picky about your menu's options."

"Oh! Right" Danny chuckled, Sam's joke wasn't helping, his palms were dripping with sweat and his knees were beginning to shake, he was sure his boss was behind him watching him mess up. "Um, we have a new veggie burger you know, tofu and everything you guys like" Danny tried to continue, picking up a paper stand up ad for the burger off the counter and reading the quotes as if Sam couldn't "Try out new Veggie burger! Now even you meat hating tree huggers can have some nasty in you burg-"

Sam yanked the ad from his hand before he could finish and threw it behind her, Danny leaned on the cash register trying to grab the ad before it was thrown out of his reach, he pushed several buttons. "No Danny I don't want one of those cheap attempts to profit off the green crowd. Besides those things contain very little tofu, they are mostly fatty grease and processed Fat to simulate the beef taste, they are worse than the real burgers. Look just give me a large salad and a small order of fries" Sam said trying to make things simple for Danny. "And no receipt, I don't want to kill trees so I can have a paper reminder of what I ate!"

"O-ok" Danny sweated hunting keys again. He had trouble remembering what all the abbreviations on the keys meant, before he was done Danny had entered 2 large orders of fries and a bowl of ice cream covered in cookie bits. And covered in chocolate in addition to the other buttons he had hit earlier. Danny looked at the total, 12.35 "that can't be right" he thought, Danny assumed the register was messing up and added up the order of a larger salad and a small fry in his head. "That will be 4.24, your order is number 97a" Danny said at last and began to wait for the fry cook to slide the tray through with her order on it

Danny tapped his fingers on the counter nervously smiling at Sam who seemed to be finding the whole situation down right comical poking fun at Danny a few times while the waited by telling him his hat was on backwards or his name tag was upside down, every time Danny freaked out and checked she'd burst out laughing.

"Order 97a up!" came a voice from behind the wall of equipment and a tray covered in far more food than they were expecting slid through the small opening.

"Danny" Sam exclaimed "just what did you order me?"

"I don't know, I must have hit the wrong buttons" Danny nervously told her as he moved the tray to the counter so they could inspect the order. "I wasn't sure what buttons were which but I know I didn't hit this many!" Danny tried to explain and checked the receipt on the tray to make sure it was the same order number, to his dismay it was.

"Danny you ordered me 2 of these greasy veggie burgers?! With cheese? 2 orders of large fries? An apple pie? A chocolate fudge sundae with cookie bits? Danny do you want me to spit on my vegan ideals and ruin my diet?! Sam scolded him

"I, I don't know how..." Danny started before he heard something that made his blood run cold...

The manager clear his throat and stepped in behind Danny, "Is there a problem here...?" He asked glaring down at Danny. "Did you mess this young lady's order up?"

"I... I mean I..." Danny stammered

"No, he did not sir" Sam dove into the conversation and saved Danny "I was just asking him to help me check the order, to make sure it was right, but he forgot my... um my..." Sam searched for a reason she'd be yelling at him

"Her milkshake!" Danny jumped back in "She wanted a big Milkshake and I forgot to prepare one for her! Sorry Sir and Ma'am, its my first day you know..." He said looking sheepish

"Yeah..." Sam said shooting Danny a dirty look before the manager turned back to her "My... milkshake... a big... chocolatey.... calorie filled.... milk... shake. I was yelling because I mistook his inexperience as an attempt to cheat me out of my full order, I am over sensitive about that stuff..." She finished with a nervous smile

"Yes well... my apologies miss" the manager said and fetched her the milkshake quickly "But if you'll excuse me... I'll be watching to make sure you eat all of it, I'd hate to find out this young man couldn't even handle his first order and needed a customer to cover for him" The manager said menacingly and glaring down at Danny again who practically melted in his shoes from the stare.

Sam looked to Danny as well for help about what she was going to do with all this food. Danny however was sweating bullets as the manager checked Danny's uniform and gave him a stern reminder on the "Nasty Burger image". Sam took her tray and looked at the mountain of food, She wondered if Danny could take a break soon and help her eat some of it, but just as the manager took his leave a crowd of customers pushed past her and the lunch rush began, Danny was to busy to talk to. Sam simply found a seat and tried to manage to eat her feast of fattening foods knowing the manager could be watching...

It DID felt like someone was watching...
12211.title: More friend than vegetarian

choices: Sam can't resist and goes looking for another fast food place
Danny blows off work and tries to find Sam
122112.content:
Sam stared at the greasy burger in her hands, it was even colored to look like a real burger. Sam's stomach churned thinking about the animals that died so their fat could be used to flavor a tofu burger. Sam looked towards the counter again to check if the manager really was watching. No one but Danny was back there, maybe she could just...

Sam began to place the burger back in the tray to throw this garbage where it belonged when something caught her eye. Looking up Sam could see a camera inside one of the dark domes hanging from the ceiling meant to hide which way the camera was facing. The light was catching it just right, Sam could see one of the cameras meant to watch the side door was turning to face her, no doubt the manager was keeping an eye on her.

"This is for you Danny..." Sam grimaced and took a bite out of one of the burgers. The juices melted in her mouth, Sam winced her eyes as she chewed but it was only because she was eating something she swore she never would, in reality the burger tasted amazing. Sam was torn she didn't know what she hated more, the fact she was eating meat by products, or the fact they tasted so great...

"This is wrong, this cow wasn't born so it could die and be my meal!" Sam tried to reason herself. However the burger's taste beckoned her, no matter what reason she gave to say no, the burger would just say yes. Sam closed her eyes and shoved the burger in taking a larger bite. Sam moaned softly and leaned her head back feeling the amazing sensation from having something so flavorful on her taste buds. Sam just turned off her consciousness to end the nagging battle over the morality of meat eating and slipped into a trance just taking a bite and savoring every bit of the taste. Soon she had finished the burger and couldn't get the second one open fast enough, Sam was acting on impulse trying not to think about what she was doing.

Across the street a young woman dressed like a goth punk and bright blue hair done up in a pony tail was watching Sam with increasing interest...

"Well well what a little piggy you are Samantha Manson" Ember said watching Sam.

She was standing just far enough away from the Nasty Burger that Danny's ghost sense didn't pick her up, she didn't want him to interfere until her plan was in full motion.

"Hey, Ember, can you like, place that song again?" Asked a spacey eyed teen behind her.

Ember turned to face five teens dressed in similar gothic or punk like attire. There was four of them were guys and two were girls, and all had blank doll like eyes looking back at her but not seeming to focus on anything in particular.

"Of course my pet" Ember smiled "I've followed that ghost boy long enough to learn all I need to know about him and his friends, and what's more his dear little girlfriend has given me a delicious ideas..." Ember began to laugh manically and flipped the guitar off her back around into her hands. Ember started walking down the street plucking the strings. Ember's mindless toys followed her happily.

"This song is so.... awesome" one of the boys said dreamily

"Yeah..." Added one of the girls also detached from reality

"come along my little ones" Ember cooed "It's time I prepare you to keep that mettlesome ghost boy busy"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------

Sam leaned back in her booth seat and groaned. She has plowed through the entire meal with wreakless abandon. What had begun as a plot to keep from facing herself for eating meat had lead Sam to just trance herself for the full feast. Sam was afraid to face herself for eating the burgers, because it went against her ideals, because it was wrong, because she liked it...

"What was I thinking..." Sam moaned. She didn't know what made her think as long as she was shoving food in her mouth then she'd be free from the moral responsibilities for her actions. "Karma is going to get me for this I know it..." Sam cried clutching her belly.

"Hey Sam!" Danny happily greeted her sitting across from her "I think the manager is mad at me..." Danny told her placing a tray with two hamburgers and large order of fries "I got though most of the lunch rush without messing up to much but I started getting nervous when he came to watch me and... I kinda messed up a big order..." Danny sighed

Sam groaned and clutched her gut as she tried to sit up a little to face Danny better, luckily Danny was busy unwrapping his burger and didn't see the trouble she was having

"So *urp* what happened Danny?" Sam asked trying to get her mind away from the meat issue in the back of her mind. However Sam couldn't stop looking at the second burger, she was stuffed full unable to eat another bite, but that burger looked so good. Sam's mouth waters and her stomach began to hurt slightly as it strained to stretch and make room for one more as her appetite grew.

"Oh... you know... He started looking over my shoulder and I got nervous. I ordered the customer 2 burgers to many and an extra order of fries... He got upset and told me to just go take a break and let him finish the rush. He gave me the extra burgers and fries to eat for my lunch but I think he's deducting them from my paycheck, if this keeps up I'll end up owing HIM money by pay day..." Danny explained upset "This can't be good for my performance review..."

Sam barely focused on what Danny said, she was disgusted with herself for it but all she could think about was trying that burger.

"Hey you managed to trash that food without the manager seeing huh?" Danny tried to smile looking for a new subject and took notice of Sam's empty tray "Sorry for making you cover for me. Do you want this?" Danny offered meaning the fries, Sam however only heard what she wanted and assumed her meant the burger, without even hesitating she agreed and snatched up the double cheese burger with bacon and tore off the wrapper greedily licking her lips.

"Sam no that's meat!" Danny called out to late to stop Sam from taking a big juicy bite.

"Huh?" Sam said with a mouthful of meat. She quickly swallowed the mouthful and placed the burger back on the tray.

"Sam you ate meat!" Danny was shocked "I'm sorry I should have warned you sooner these aren't tofu!"

"I, uh..." Sam stammered quickly getting up "it's o-ok, I should go now, karma and stuff you know? gotta cleanse my soul of this and stuff!" Sam lied and hurried out the door leaving Danny sitting stunned.

Sam rushed town the sidewalk walking quickly clutching her stuffed belly as she did. The taste of that meat haunted her mind. Her taste buds kept replaying the taste over and over taunting her. Sam didn't know what to think...
122112.title: Sam's got a new bag?

choices: Sam treats Ember to quite a ride!
1221121.content:
"Just stand still and let them enter your bodies my pretty little puppets" Ember sighed pre-occupied with the rhythm she was playing on her guitar. The hypnotized teens stood motionless with empty smiles on their faces in the center of the abandoned warehouse Ember had led them to. Ember was propped up on near by crate playing a dark foreboding melody on her guitar as the shadows in the corners of the warehouse seemed to grow and inch towards the teens.

"Now is the dark age, here is the shadows" Ember methodically sang "Arise young ethereals, embrace the darkness" Ember stood and began to play faster "These are your bodies these are your hosts, enter them now! Bind to their ghosts!" Ember slammed her fist across her guitar and the shadows exploded from their places around the room and engulfed the teens standing idly in the center of the room. Ember took a step back and frowned upon the swirling black mass waiting for it to subside. Slowly the darkness began to ebb away as the teens now stood with dark grins on their faces. Their eyes were black with a dark haze arising from them and the teen's seemed to project a haunting shadow aura around their bodies. Ember placed her hand on her hip and looked at them with an unimpressed stare.

"Thank you for giving us these new forms little she ghost" One of the dark beings spoke his words seeming to slip in and out of phase with existence in a dark rhythm "Since you gave us new life we will serve you for as long as you require". The former teens all cackled in agreement and looked around at the world they now inhabited.

"Stow it you little shadow twerp" Ember spat unhappily "First off I don't like your kind, I'm not a nice girl but I'm not pure evil like you. Frankly if I hadn't found these kids wasting their life on drugs and worthless existence I'd have never taken them to use in this ritual. Second I only summoned you things because I need something strong enough to keep a certain dweeb ghost busy while I wreak havoc on his life, after that I'm putting you right back in the shadows where you belong!" Ember declared with a wave of her arm and looked at the dark eyes of the teens with a stern glare.

The dark being all let out a soft chuckle as if they didn't care. "We will see little ghost youngling, we will see" One of the dark forms spoke. "We have lived countless millennia and served many different masters, unlike your pitiful time as a ethereal being which is less than a few years we have the experience of the ages, We'll outlast you just like all the others... Who knows? Maybe we'll even convert you into one of us" Another one chimed in and ran his finger under the chin of one of the girls to emphasize Ember wouldn't be the first.

"Yeah" Ember snorted and narrowed her eye's "We'll see..."

=======================================================

Danny pushed the door into the customer dinning area open with his backside and pulled a mop and bucket through. The Nasty Burger was getting ready to close for the night and not being experienced enough to clean the cookware or trusted enough yet to remove and count the cash from the registers his job was to mob the floors and clean the restrooms. Danny grunted as he lifted the bucket over the threshold of the doorway to keep it from tipping over and put it back down.

"Stupid manager" Danny mumbled "Sam could have needed help, I still had 20 minuets left in my break why did he have to yell at me and embarrass me like that in from of the entire lunch crowd.." Danny murmured still angry over the incident earlier when he tried to follow after Sam and the manager had to chase him down and pull him back into the restaurant. "Geez, like I was really trying to escape or something" Danny gritted his teeth both mad as his boss and worried about Sam.

"Sounds like a real tool" Someone behind him said in a weird tone

"Yeah he... huh?" Danny almost responded but turned to the source of the voice and saw a young man enveloped in a dark glow standing behind him

"Hi" the teen spoke before shoving Danny backwards in a pale flash sending Danny flying across the restaurant slamming him into several tables before hitting the wall hard.

"Wha? Who are you?!" Danny demanded shaking a broken chair off his back and standing only to see the spot where the attacker had stood was now empty.

"Me?" The voice came again but this time from his left "I'm just a shadow" The being explained and gave Danny a firm upper cut to the side of his jaw before Danny could turn to face him. Danny flew up and away from the creature into the ceiling tiles and got hung up on a steel support rafter.

"Ghosts?" Danny grunted trying to regain his balance as he hung awkwardly upside down "But my ghost sense.." Danny tried to wonder when the dark form attacked again.

"Your ghost sense doesn't do jack when the thing attacking you is made of shadows and not some pathetic ghost!" The being shrieked before grabbing Danny by the collar and throwing him down into the floor again. Floor tiles flew up and dust erupted from the impact as the shadow laughed manically. However the dark form's laugher was cut short as a flash of light burst from the dust and Danny flew up in his ghost form catching the shadow off guard and plowed into him with his right fist throwing the shadow form back onto the floor and bounced several times before rolling to a stop at the feet of a second shadow form, The first shadow being just wheezed and tried to stand back up. Danny glanced to the counter to make sure no one has seen him go into the floor and a phantom come out, luckily there was no one but Danny didn't remember hearing anyone scream and terror before running away, Before Danny could wonder anymore about it the second form spoke.

"So it's true, you really do have ghost powers" He said and turned to his companion "And you Ru'gol, How foolish you were to openly attack him like that, you know our powers will take some time to fully return to us, now you've gone and exhausted yourself without barely damaging him." The shadow looked back to Danny with an stare of indifference "I'm sure that little vixen summoned us with this in mind, that we run ourselfs out fighting him so that she won't have to deal with him. I'd rather not lose to a ghost, and I'd really hate to be beaten by some half-ling who's still part human..." The shadow growled some malice entering his voice. Meanwhile his companion Ru'gol slumped on the floor and his dark twisting form subsided to reveal the human body her was using.

"What are these guys..." Danny gasped seeing the shadow turn into a human before blocking a shadow claw swung at him from his right.

=======================================================

Sam was standing in line at a Greasy Greg's Hamburgers, lost in her own hunger. Sam had wandered around the town for hours trying to push the thought of meat out of her head. She didn't dare go home where her parents had tried to get her to try a normal meal for years and at the moment she was afraid they may just succeed. Sam had been forcing herself to steer away from many restaurants as the smells from them beckoned to her. However after hours of licking the air dreaming of that meat taste she finally broke down while passing Greasy Greg's when the smell of burgers being char broiled assaulted her senses and pulled her inside.

Sam was to lost in the cravings to notice the girl behind the counter jump slightly as Sam stepped up and a soft blue glow filled the cashier's eyes. Sam scanned the menu not noticing the odd grin the cashier suddenly looked at her with, to Sam's dismay, everything looked amazingly good tonight, especially the hamburgers.

"I.. I'll have..." Sam stammered wanting a burger so badly she could jump the counter and grab one off the grill "Oh... I want..." Sam indecisively moaned

"Hi and welcome to Greasy Greg's Hun! Home of the Barn Lard Burger!" The overly perky cashier bubbled as if excited to wait on Sam. "You're our 100th customer of the night, you get a free meal!" The girl exclaimed getting a confused look from the cashier beside her. "Just have a seat and I'll bring you your meal!" She smiled broadly.

"Huh? Oh ok..." Sam trailed off still drooling over the smell of beef cooking. Sam moved for her table but kept looking past the girl at the fry cook flipping burgers. Sam sat down but felt lost, she wanted her food now, what was this 100th customer stuff and how long before she got something to eat? Sam squirmed in her seat for what felt like an eternity but was only a minute The girl came out with a tray loaded with food and placed it before Sam.

Sam was feeling the shock of reality return to her as she looked at the pile of food before her. 5 or 6 thick greasy hamburgers loaded with condiments, several cartons of fries pile ontop one another, a bucket of fried chicken to the side and a very large bowl of ice cream. Sam's jaw slacked as if to say no way but her eyes were filled with hunger.

Ember exited the cashier girl and crept behind Sam in her intangible form to prevent being seen. The poor cashier girl looked confused and wondered how she got there. She looked to Sam for an answer but Sam's world seemed to revolve around the food before her and the girl was left to find her own answer which came from her manager yelling angrily to get her butt back behind the counter.

Sam's mind was in war between hunger and reality and poor Sam was stuck in the middle. Ember giggled at the sight and moved in next to Sam's ear

"Eat..." She spoke softer than the wind so that Same couldn't tell the difference between another voice or her own thoughts "Eat it..." Ember spoke again. Sam's eyes weakened and she inched forward still holding herself back, her mouth flooded with drool and it built up behind her lower lip cresting over the top just barely holding back. "It's soooo good" Ember moaned into Sam's ear causing Sam to slip forward more to within less than a foot of her gluttonous feast, Sam's drool bulged forward and threatened to dribble down her chin and onto the table. Sam's eyes were dead set on the greasy burger on the top of the pile dripping with Lard and Ketchup.

Ember smiled and phased her head into Sam's, She didn't posses Sam's mind but she did sync up with it enough to place her mouth where Sam's was and make Same lick her lips influencing Sam to taste a burst of flavor from nowhere when she did. Sam's will shattered in a blind rush and Sam nearly slammed her head into the pile of food tearing away from Ember's hold and cramming the burger into her mouth.

Sam was shoving the burger against her teeth as hard as she could, she didn't even pull it away she only pushed more in as she chewed what she had already eaten. Sam's eyes lost all focus and seemed to fade out as her body went into auto pilot shoving the food into her mouth as fast as it could as Sam gave up all modesty and made a spectical of herself in the restaurant, Sam moaned in pleasure at the tastes of it all and sounded like she was having an orgasm from the flavor.

(( http://img180.imageshack.us/img180/3126/... ))

Ember smiled wickedly at the sight, she almost wished she hadn't pushed Sam into it just to see how long the little piggy could have lasted on her own. Sam moaned in delight as she shoved the last bit of the burger into her mouth as hard as she could making her cheeks puff out into two taunt spheres on either side of her mouth and chewed as fast as she could as she lined up two hand fulls of fries behind it. Ember could only imagine what thoughts were going through Sam's mind as she ate. Sam was acting like a wild animal starving for food. Ember decided to test her theory out and ghosted into Sam's body to watch the sight from a closer view as well as hear Sam's thoughts.

Ember slipped into Sam's body and was assaulted by raw hunger. There was no thoughts to listen to and there was no resisting Sam's movements for more food. An instinctive urge to eat dominated Sam's being and bombarded Ember's mind as Sam's sole purpose in life seemed to be to eat this meal and Ember's spirit was having a hard time staying separate form Sam's wild and untamed urges. Sam just Grabbed the next Burger and treated both herself and Ember to the greatest tasting hamburger either of them had ever had.

Danny woke up the next morning...
1222111122.content:
Danny turned around to see Sam and Tucker standing there, holding hands. They had started to date almost two months ago after Danny had turned Sam down when she had asked him out. Originally Danny had just thought that Sam had gone to Tucker on the rebound, but since they were still going strong and their relationship just seemed to be getting stronger, that maybe Sam really did care a lot for Tucker. That was fine with him. He liked Sam as a friend and all, but he just couldn't date her.

"Hardy-har-har Tuck." Danny replied since Tucker had been the one to make the comment. Tucker grinned and Sam elbowed him.

"Ow!"

"Be nice Tucker." she growled. Tucker rubbed his ribs where she had elbowed him, not apologizing but flashing Danny an apologetic grin. Danny just grinned back.

"So what are you two up to?" Danny asked, feeling a little guilty knowing that he had been blowing them off a bit for the past week because he was working so much and actually spending a lot of his free time eating. His appetite had really improved since he had started to work at Nasty Burger.

"We're on our way to the movies to go watch that new movie that just came out." Tucker replied. Sam grinned viciously.

"Screaming Souls: The Rise of the Reaper." Sam cackled evilly, imitating the commercial. Tucker shivered.

"Don't do that!" he whined. Danny laughed.

"You guys are going to go see a horror movie about ghosts? Don't you get enough of me fighting them?" he asked. Sam and Tucker grinned at him.

"Not really anymore. Ever since your parents shut down the portal, you've been fighting ghosts less and less." Sam pointed out. Tucker nodded.

"Yeah man. Either that or you just stopped calling us. I mean, you haven't called us in over a week."

Danny blinked in surprised and thought back to the last time he had fought any ghosts. The last time he had fought a ghost was three days before he started his job at Nasty Burger.

"Wow, I hadn't realized how long it's been since I fought any ghosts." he laughed, scratching the back of his head. Suddenly his watched beeped, making him jump a little. "Oh, sorry guys but I gotta go. I got to go deposit my check in the bank before it closes then I gotta get back to work." he explained.

"You're still working on a Saturday?" Sam asked, blinking in surprise. "I thought you only had to work a couple hours during the weekdays."

Danny grinned. "One of the other guys quit so they have me working weekdays from 4 to 10, which is closing now, by the way, and on weekends I work from 3 to closing. They also gave me a raise since I'm working extra hours too." he explained proudly. Tucker whistled.

"Wow man. I'm still just working four hours at the computer store stocking the shelves." Sam kissed him on the cheek.

"My working man." Tucker blushed. Both he and Danny knew that Sam would never have to work a day of her life since her family was so rich, but she still supported Tucker and Danny in getting jobs and had even applied a couple of places, but she never got calls back or never made it through the interview because of how she dressed.

"Well, I best be going. See you guys!" Danny said, starting to jog towards the bank. Sam and Tucker waved as well, then continued walking towards the movie theater.

Danny hadn't even jogged halfway down the block before he started to get winded. Sweat started to form on his brow and once he was out of sight of Tucker and Sam, he stopped, bending down with his hands on his knees, catching his breath.

'Doy! Why am I running?' Danny smacked his head when he remembered that he had ghost powers. He went and ducked behind a dumpster, turning ghost. He then blinked in surprise as he looked down.

He was still skinny as Danny Phantom! Now that was strange!

Shaking away his shock, he turned invisible and began to fly quickly to the bank. When he got there, he ducked behind some bushes and then walked inside to deposit his check.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Danny groaned as he finished off another burger, making notes on how different it had tasted from the last one he had eaten only an hour prior. They had started bringing him different kinds of burgers throughout the hour, repeating a different variation of each burger when the new hour hit. In reality, rather than eating the one burger an hour that he had started out with, he was now eating 5 burgers an hour, which meant that on weekdays he ate 30 burgers a day, and on weekends he ate 35 burgers a day.

[The grilled variation with honey bbq sauce tastes better than the grilled variation with soy sauce, but not as good as the grilled variation with seasoning and regular bbq sauce.] Danny wrote down in the log book.

Leaning back he sighed once more, reaching over to grab his Mega-Glug cup of soda pop. He drank the last fourth of it before setting the container back down. He then began to rub his swollen belly, a satisfied smile on his lips.

He loved this. Whoever's idea it was to create a taste tester job should be given the Nobel prize, Danny decided. After all, it was because of that person that this was all happening to him, and he was loving it.

"Hey Danny," a voice came from the door of his office. Danny blushed, having been caught rubbing his belly and relaxing. He sat back up straight and saw that it was his boss standing in the doorway. Blushing even more, Danny stood up.

"Hey Robert. What's up?" he asked, fighting down his embarrassment. Robert walked in.

"Sit back down, Danny. I just want to talk with you." he said, shutting the door behind him. Danny sat down, feeling nervous. What did he want to talk about? And why was he closing the door?

"Alright then." Danny said, moving his Mega-Glug cup a little further out of the way.

"Danny, do you know why Andrew quit?" Robert asked as he came over and sat down. Danny remembered that Andrew had been the other taste tester but had left two weeks after he had started. He and Andrew had never met.

"Um, no. What does his quitting have anything to do with this?" Danny asked. Robert sighed.

"Andrew quit because of all the weight he gained. He signed a form, the same form you signed, saying that any weight gains or health problems caused by weight gain from the job is not our fault. Andrew is now attempting to sue us. I just wanted to talk to you about your weight gain that I've noticed-" Robert began. Danny smiled and laughed, interrupting Robert.

"Oh, my weight gain is very much wanted, I assure you. I have no problem with gaining weight." Danny assured him. Robert blinked in surprise.

"Really?" he asked. Danny nodded.

"Yeah, I mean, well, I wanted to get bigger because, you know, I get picked on at school a lot, and I figured, hey, if I get bigger then they can't pick on me so much, you know?" Danny informed him in a jumbled, embarrassed manner. Robert laughed.

"Yeah, it was the same for me back when I was in high school. I got picked on a lot so I started gaining a lot of weight and bulking up so they couldn't pick on me. I understand how it is." Robert explained. Danny blinked.

'Well, that explains why his arms are huge and as hard as rocks while his stomach's a little pudgy.' Danny thought to himself. Robert was in his late twenties, about 28, and he enjoyed working at Nasty Burger. He was a nice guy with good looks, someone who could easily land a date with a pretty girl.

"So, you don't have a problem with gaining weight?" Robert asked just to make sure. Danny shook his head.

"Nope, I don't have a problem with gaining weight. Bring it on!" he joked, laughing. Robert laughed as well.

"Alright, I was just checking." There was a knock at the door. "Oh, looks like your next burger's here." Robert said, standing up. "Speaking of burgers, I was now wondering if you would like to now be fed 20 more burgers in an hour. If you do, i will pay you 100 dollars extra and you will have on weekdays you would eat 150 burgers and on weekends you would eat 175 burgers." Danny immediately said "I would love to. I really don't care about how much weight i gain and plus now i am hungry all the time. Keep on stuffing me up! I need it for school!" Danny said. "Good," the manager said. Then He looked at Danny's Mega-Glug cup that was empty and chuckled, picking it up.

"Want me to fill this up for you since I'm up?" he asked. Danny grinned.

"Yeah, that'd me great." he replied.

"Whatcha drinkin'?" Robert asked, heading towards the door, letting Carol, one of the girls on grill duty today, in with the next burger that Danny had to drink.

"Um... Mountain Dew. Might as well change things up a bit." Danny replied, taking the burger from Carol.

"Alrighty then." Robert said, disappearing through the door. Danny then turned to Carol, who was grinning at him.

"This burger has wasabi and-"

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Danny stretched as he walked out of Nasty Burger, saying goodbye to the remaining other three employees who were stuck with closing. He was so glad that his job didn't entail closing duty.

As he put his arms down, Danny noticed that his stomach was so swollen that his shirt was resting on the top of his stomach. He grinned, rubbing his swollen belly. It then gave a rather loud rumble, shocking and amusing Danny at the same time. He loved the fact that he could eat more and more now. He didn't care.

"Alright baby, I'll get you some food." Danny murmured to his growling stomach, caressing it like a pregnant woman would rub her belly. "Alright, where's open?" Danny thought for a minute then remembered that the pizza parlor was still upon for an hour after Nasty Burger closed. The bad part was that the pizza parlor was on the other side of town. How would he make-

"Ghost powers! Duh!" Danny said, grinning again. Making sure that no one was around to see, he went ghost and took off zooming for the pizza parlor. When he landed behind the pizza parlor, he marveled once again at how thin he was in his ghost form. Before he had started his job at Nasty Burger, his ghost form and his human form had been the same weight. It was a little shocking to see just how much weight he had gained in just a month from taste testing burgers.

Danny then turned back into his human form, he pulled his shirt as far as he could over his stomach before walking in. Looking up at the ordering board, his stomach began to growl incessantly, making it hard for him to concentrate.

"Can I help you?" the girl behind the counter asked. Danny sighed before smiling at her.

"Yeah, I'd like five large pizzas with sausage and olives. To take home." he informed her. She put down his order. He paid her as she told him the estimated time it would take for them to finish his order, so shrugging, he went over to one of the boots to wait.

Bored, Danny started to look around. He then noticed Dash and Paulina walking past the pizza parlor. Paulina was laughing at something, most likely something that Dash had said, and Dash was grinning like he had just scored a touch down or something. Danny sighed.

He had used to wish that Paulina would look at him and laugh like that at things he said, but last year, after his 16th birthday, Danny had finally realized just how much of an airhead she really was. It had taken about six months for his crush to die after he realized just how shallow and uninteresting she really was. He had just been so caught up in her beauty he hadn't seen the rest of the package.

"Here's your pizzas, sir." a voice chirped next to him. He jumped and turned to see the girl who had taken his order standing next to him with all five of his pizzas in their boxes. He smiled as he took them.

"Thanks." he told her, standing up. She smiled.

"Your welcome sir. Enjoy your pizzas." She glanced down at his stomach before meeting his eyes again, giving him a knowing smile. Blinking in surprise, Danny watched as she turned around and returned behind the counter, from where she winked at him.

She winked at him!

What the heck?!

Shaking his head, feeling confused, Danny turned and left the pizza parlor, ducking behind the parlor once more before going ghost and flying home with all five of his pizzas. Once he got him, by flying in through his open window, Danny sat on his bed and began to plow through the pizzas.

After the first one, Danny groaned and unbuttoned and unzipped his pants. His stomach gushed forwards and plopped down, swollen and heavy with food. Rubbing his stomach a bit, Danny began on his second pizza, caressing his stomach between each slice as it grew larger and tauter.

After the third pizza, Danny groaned and took off his shirt, feeling like it was getting too tight. His man boob jiggled with each breath he heaved, a little flushed and out of breath from his vigorous eating. He then pulled off his pants, feeling better as the restricting denim was finally removed. He then began to finish off the last two boxes in just his boxers.

When he finished the last pizza, barely though because he felt so full, Danny realized just how thirsty he was. He debated about whether or not he should pull on a pair of pajama pants or not, before deciding not to. It was like anyone else was home.

Jazz was off at college, having a blast. Ever since she had left, their parents had started to spend more and more time down in the basement working on their inventions. They had closed off the portal, concentrating more on inventions on how to capture and imprison ghosts rather than kill. They had said that the portal wasn't something that they had wanted to concentrate on.

Then about four months ago, about four months after Jazz had gone off to college, they had started getting letters requesting them to come speak at science conventions and such. They were gone all the time, and during the rare time when they were home, they were always down in the basement. Danny rarely ever saw them.

And right now, they were away at another convention.

So, Danny padded downstairs in just his socks and boxers, his large belly and man boobs jiggling with every step he took. He made his way to the kitchen and got into the fridge. He dug around before he found a two liter of pop.

Mom always made sure that there was food in the house for him, going so far as to have this delivery service stock the kitchen every week. His parents didn't even know that he had a job at Nasty Burger, so they were unaware of what he did with most of his spare time.

Danny opened the two liter and began to chug it then and there with the fridge still open. He drank greedily, ignoring as some rivulets managed to escape and make their way down his cheeks, man boobs and swollen belly. He kept drinking until the plastic bottle was empty. Then he drank two more.

He then let out a tremendous belch, making his belly jiggle. Chuckling, Danny closed the fridge and threw away the bottles before making his way back upstairs, his belly larger and a loud sloshing could be heard as he walked.

Yawning as he walked into his room, Danny shoved thepizza boxes onto the floor before crashing on his bed and going to sleep.

Danny wakes up late for work
12221111221.content:
Danny woke a couple of hours later to the phone ringing. Groaning and muttering dark curses, Danny pulled himself, quit reluctantly, out of bed and stumbled down the hall to where the phone was.

"Eh?" Danny managed to growl, swiping a hand over his face.

"Hi honey!" a cheerful female voice came over the phone. His brow furrowed as it took his tired mind a couple of minutes to recognize the voice of his mother's voice. "Danny honey, are you still there?"

"Yeah. Mom, do you know what time it is?" Danny demanded with another grumpy, sleep filled growl. He leaned against the wall, sliding down it until he was sitting on the phone, the phone still pressed firmly against his ear.

"Of course I do sweety! It's four in the afternoon!" Maddie chirped in reply. "Are you feeling well? You sound kind of funny."

Danny blinked as he peered at the clock down the hall, somehow managing to read that it was two in the morning.

"Mom, it's two in the morning here at home. You woke me up." Danny mumbled, considering going back to bed when his stomach suddenly gave off a fierce rumble. That surprised Danny and he blinked down at his stomach that was still quite swollen from his dinner earlier. He was hungry so soon?

"Danny? Are you still there?" Maddie demanded, her tone sounding worried.

"Eh, what? Oh, yeah mom, I'm still here. Sorry, I think I just dozed off a little there." Danny replied sheepishly, standing up, huffing with the exertion of hauling his heavy frame from up off of the floor. He then began to make his way down the hall towards the kitchen.

"Danny, the reason why I'm calling is to tell you that your father and I won't be able to return home for the next month, maybe two. We were asked to help with a study here in Tokyo, and well, your father was just so excited and the information that could result from this could open an entirely new field of study for ghosts. But to be quite honest, I don't think it'll be more than a month or two." Maddie explained hurriedly.

Danny had just entered the kitchen and flicked on the lights, groaning as the lights burned his retina's. He rubbed his eyes then peered at the calendar. He blinked a couple of times, reading the day's date. April 17th.

"Mom, you guys are going to miss-" Danny began before all of a sudden his dad's voice came blaring over the phone.

"Don't worry, Dan-o! Your mother and I are still going to keep sending you plenty of money. In fact, your mother just two days ago opened up a bank account just for you and we'll deposit a weekly allowance in there for you to go do things with Sam and Tuck, buy new clothes, pay the bills, and all that junk. Gotta go, Dan-o! Our rides here!" Jack boomed.

"We love you sweety. Stay safe and do well in school! Bye!" came Maddie's voice before the line went dead. A little stunned, Danny turned off the phone.

His mom and dad were going to miss his graduation. And all because of their ghost obsession! Why did his life always take a back seat to their ghost obsession? Jazz's life never had been forced to be put on hold by their paranormal jobs! It wasn't fair!

Danny then chucked the cordless phone, ignoring the load crash as it hit the wall and shattered. His stomach gave another angry gurgle, as if agreeing with him that his parents were being unjust and that they should deal with the anger and the hurt by consuming large quantities of food.

"I can't believe them!" Danny seethed as he went about digging in the fridge, pulling out a six pack of pop, sandwich ingredients and then went and started to make him some sandwiches, using up two loaves of bread in order to do so.

Once all of his sandwiches were made, he stood there at the counter, looking back on all the injustices that he felt that his parents had ever inflicted upon him. He was so caught up in his memories that when he went to reach for another sandwich, he discovered that he had already eaten them all and that he had also finished off the entire six pack.

Still hungry and angry, Danny pulled a couple of frozen pizzas from the freezer and popped one in the over. He then dug around the fridge until he came up with a gallon of orange juice. He then dug around in the cupboards, pulling out bags of chips, cookies, snack packs, puddings, and cans of ready to go pasta and such.

He pulled out a couple bowls and a can opener. He opened up all the cans of raviolis, beef stroganoff, spaghetti-ohs, meat noodles, and spaghetti. He poured each can into the bowls and then placed them in the microwave, not caring enough to look at how long that should actually be in the microwave. He then started on the bags of chips.

"I mean, I'm their son! Don't they care about me at all? Really, what kind of parents miss their kid's graduation?" he demanded, angrily pulling the safety seal on the orange juice before quickly twisting off the cap and bringing the mouth of the jug to his lips.

He then began to chug it, ignoring the fact that two streams of orange juice was leaking from the corners of his mouth, leaving down his cheeks and neck, down his fleshy chest and ample belly, down his belly and then soaking into his boxers. He listened to the soft 'glug-glug-glug' as he gulped down the rushing orange liquid before he finally felt the urge to burp. He set the container back down, wiping his mouth with his arm, letting out a tremendous belch.

He sighed, rubbing his sloshing stomach before his anger towards his parents returned. He then grabbed the bag of chips that he had been eating out of and began to crunch them furiously.

"They went to Jazz's graduation! Do they just not want to come to mine just because I'm not valedictorian? Or is it because they know that I'm a failure? A screw up?" he whispered the last part, depression washing over him. He then noticed that he was out of chips. He wiped his greasy hand off on his boxers before grabbing some of the pudding packs.

"It's not my fault that I'm not smart like Jazz. I don't know if anyone can be as smart as Jazz!" Danny cried, cramming a spoonful of chocolate pudding into his mouth. "Why do mom and dad love Jazz and not me?" Danny demanded sadly.

He continued to eat his pudding cups in silence, thinking back to all the things that his parents had ever done for Jazz. Attending her school plays, her recitals when she was in ballet before she quit when she was ten. They had gone to her elementary school graduation, her middle school graduation and her high school graduation. They had even driven her to college despite the fact that her college had offered to send her airline tickets and she could have her belongings sent to her. His parents had done a lot more things for Jazz than they had ever done for him.

Like the time Jazz had stopped eating for a week, stressing over her paper, his parents had noticed and forced her to stop, eat and took her to see a psychologist for a little while. They hadn't even noticed how he was stealing their ghost hunting tools and how Danny Phantom appeared and used them to defeat his ghostly opponents.

"I hate my parents." Danny muttered angrily. He then went about eating the rest of everything that he had pulled out, cooking all of the pizzas and eating them as well, drinking all of the orange juice in the fridge, the gallon of milk, and then some kool-aid mix that he had found and used to make kool-aid with.

When he was done, Danny just left everything in the sink before turning and returning upstairs to bed, ignoring the fact that it was now 6 in the morning. His stomach hurt from all the food he had eaten and he was still feeling angry and depressed about his parents and their obvious neglect of him.
